Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2015 05:33AM florida2015 wrote: I had my lumpectomy March 3. Left breast Even though things were explained before to me I didn't really know what to expect. Some parts were very uncomfortable. But nurses were very kind and loving. I don't remember a thing from time I was given sedation I woke up back in my room. Ready to get dressed and eat something. Went home same day. Next day was rough because had a reaction to pain med. And decided not to take it. Slept on and off that day and next day sore but fine The worst parts are waiting for results. Thankfully it is small .08 and no cancer in nodes. It is anticipated I will have radiation and go on a drug but wIting for results from Oncotype tests. I will find out more from radiologists on April 3.

Posts.Content: florida2015 wrote: I just took a xanax because I can't calm myself down. I get my results next week and made sure to tell the dr's office to not call me until then so I can have a few days enjoying my daughters visit from college. I have one daughter arriving this week and another daughter arriving from school the following week I also dread telling them as I know this will worry them tremendously. I have only told my husband, my best friend and my two sisters thst I has a lumpectomy. The growth was caught early. I was told it was stage 1 however. I don't know what the results will show. I don't work and have too much time on my hands to worry excessively. I was down before this because of having trouble this year becoming an empty nester. Anyway what has helped some of you.
